interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Brazil
Review Date: 2014/01/08
Store: Jonathan Pryce  (Actor),     Robert De Niro  (Actor),     Terry Gilliam  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Jonathan Pryce, Robert De Niro. Filled with Terry Gilliam's trademark humor and visual inventiveness, Brazil takes place in a futuristic world where individualism is revoked by a controlling state. In spite of it all, a civil servant dreams of overcoming the bureaucracy, winning over the woman he loves and reinstating true justice. A satirical, imaginative and ambitious film. 1985/color/131 min/NR/widescreen.", 'Amazon.com', "If Franz Kafka had been an animator and film director--oh, and a member of Monty Python's Flying Circus--this is the sort of outrageously dystopian satire one could easily imagine him making. However,", 'Brazil', "was made by Terry Gilliam, who is all of the above except, of course, Franz Kafka. Be that as it may, Gilliam sure captures the paranoid-subversive spirit of Kafka's", 'The Trial', "(along with his own Python animation) in this bureaucratic nightmare-comedy about a meek governmental clerk named Sam Lowry (Jonathan Pryce) whose life is destroyed by a simple bug. Not a software bug, a real bug (no doubt related to Kafka's famous", 'Metamorphosis', 'insect) that gets smooshed in a printer and causes a typographical error unjustly identifying an innocent citizen, one Mr. Buttle, as suspected terrorist Harry Tuttle (Robert De Niro). When Sam becomes enmeshed in unraveling this bureaucratic glitch, he himself winds up labeled as a miscreant.', 'The movie presents such an unrelentingly imaginative and savage vision of 20th-century bureaucracy that it almost became a victim of small-minded studio management itself--until Gilliam surreptitiously screened his cut for the Los Angeles Film Critics Association, who named it the best movie of 1985 and virtually embarrassed Universal into releasing it. This DVD version of', 'Brazil', "is the special director's cut that first appeared in Criterion's comprehensive (and expensive) six-disc laser package in 1996. Although the DVD (at a fraction of the price) doesn't include that set's many extras, it's still a bargain.", '--Jim Emerson']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, surreal movie, cult movie, movie night, buy movie, DVD movie, Art House & International, Blu-ray movie, mistaken identity movie, fantasy movie, comedy movie, cult classic, dark comedy movie, Comedy, independent movie, digital movie, indie movie, sci-fi movie, satire movie, rent movieScience Fiction & Fantasy, surreal movie, cult movie, movie night, buy movie, DVD movie, Art House & International, Blu-ray movie, mistaken identity movie, fantasy movie, comedy movie, cult classic, dark comedy movie, Comedy, independent movie, digital movie, indie…   See more', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Letterboxed', 'Contributor': 'Tom Stoppard, Terry Gilliam, Robert De Niro, Bob Hoskins, Michael Palin, Jonathan Pryce, Arnon Milchan, Charles McKeown, Katherine Helmond, Ian HolmTom Stoppard, Terry Gilliam, Robert De Niro, Bob Hoskins, Michael Palin, Jonathan Pryce, Arnon Milchan, Charles McKeown, Katherine Helmond, Ian Holm   See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 23 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 2.68 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MHV62020168DVD', 'Director': 'Terry Gilliam', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Letterboxed', 'Run time': '2 hours and 23 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 9, 2007', 'Actors': 'Jonathan Pryce, Robert De Niro, Michael Palin, Katherine Helmond, Ian Holm', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Arnon Milchan', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Terry Gilliam, Tom Stoppard, Charles McKeown', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I loved this movie when it originally came out, and I still love it today.  It holds up well.  If anything, it may be even More socially relevant today than it was when originally written, making amazingly accurate predictions about the failure of the modern workplace to become anything close to useful.  An excellent commentary on State and Federal Government offices, ineptitude glorified, and the quest for eternal youth by the rich.
Review Title: Still Excellent
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Faerie Tale Theatre - Sleeping Beauty [DVD] John Achorn (Actor), Shelley Duvall (Actor), Jeremy Kagan (Director) & 0 more Rated: G Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy ['A princess who has been put into a deep sleep by an evil fairy is awakened one hundred years later by the kiss of a prince.'] {'Format': 'Color, DVD, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Donovan Scott, John Achorn, John Salazar, Patrick DeSantis, Shelley Duvall, Charlie Dell, Mark Blankfield, Bud Cort, Rene Auberjonois, Jean Stapleton, Maysie Hoy, Charles Perrault, Jeffrey Alan Fiskin, Jeremy Kagan, David McCharenDonovan Scott, John Achorn, John Salazar, Patrick DeSantis, Shelley Duvall, Charlie Dell, Mark Blankfield, Bud Cort, Rene Auberjonois, Jean Stapleton, Maysie Hoy, Charles Perrault, Jeffrey Alan Fiskin, Jeremy Kagan, David McCharen See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '58 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.25 x 0.75 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Jeremy Kagan', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, NTSC', 'Run time': '58 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 16, 2004', 'Actors': 'John Achorn, Shelley Duvall, Patrick DeSantis, David McCharen, Charlie Dell', 'Studio': 'Starmaker II', 'Writers': 'Charles Perrault, Jeffrey Alan Fiskin', 'Number of discs': '1'} this is worth it just to hear Bernadette Peters sing "I'm nobody's baby". it is absolutely breathtaking and heartbreaking and all those wonderful qualities that only she can bring to a song. just for her voice Bette Midler: The Showgirl Must Go On Bette Midler (Actor, Director) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Music Videos & Concerts ['The Divine Miss M is back! Bette Midler returns in this Las Vegas extravaganza taped before a packed house at The Colosseum at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, the 70-minute cavalcade features an exhilarating tour de force of some of Ms. Midler’s colorful and classic stage characters. Joining her is an entourage of talented performers, including the staggering Harlettes, 16 dazzling dancers she calls The Caesar Salad Girls and a 13-piece band. Thrilling audiences with her captivating performances, Ms. Midler’s superstar power continues to shine as she belts out show stopping renditions of her biggest hits including “The Rose,” “Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy,” “From a Distance,” “Hello in There” and “Wind Beneath My Wings.”', 'Song List: Big Noise from Winnetka, The Showgirl Must Go On, Friends, The Rose, Do You Wanna Dance, From a Distance, Boolya JaDa, Hello in There, Pretty Legs/Hot in Here, Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy, Wind Beneath My Wings'] {'Genre': 'Pop, Music Video & Concerts', 'Format': 'NTSC, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Multiple Formats', 'Contributor': 'Bette Midler', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '21164824', 'Director': 'Bette Midler', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Multiple Formats', 'Run time': '1 hour and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 4, 2011', 'Actors': 'Bette Midler', 'Studio': 'IMAGE ENTERTAINMENT', 'Number of discs': '1'} I'm sure this was an incredible show at an incredible venue, but you'd never know if from the DVD. This is the worst produced DVD ever in the history of the world. The audio quality is horrible, and the video isn't much better. For gosh sakes this is LAS VEGAS in the super showroom built to house Ms Dion for five years, you know they've got the very best sound and video available, but this DVD is just a bad afterthought. It's a shame, because Ms Midler has always been captured best live on camera, and she has a whole catalogue of HBO shows that were extremely well done (but apparently aren't available today).

I've loved Bette Midler her entire career, but this DVD is absolutely a piece of crap. Do not bother. It is an insult to one of the great talents of all time. Even die-hard fans, don't bother Brazil Jonathan Pryce (Actor), Robert De Niro (Actor), Terry Gilliam (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy ['Product Description', "Jonathan Pryce, Robert De Niro. profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** Movies and TV shows, with a strong focus on the Science Fiction & Fantasy genre, and an expanding interest in musicals and concert performances.
- **Content Preference:** Enjoys family-friendly and wholesome entertainment (rated G), while also exploring live performance recordings and films that provide social commentary.
- **Artistic Appreciation:** Values strong vocal performances and musical elements, with admiration for notable artists like Bernadette Peters and Bette Midler. Displays an appreciation for imaginative storytelling and satirical narratives.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Demonstrates a fondness for classic tales and adaptations, indicating a preference for timeless stories and acclaimed artists.
- **Engagement Style:** Provides thoughtful and critical feedback, emphasizing emotional responses to artistic performances and the quality of production. Shows a tendency to apply contemporary socio-political context to classic works, expressing disappointment when production quality or relevance does not meet expectations.
- **Media Format Preference:** Prefers physical media formats, particularly DVDs, and values special director's cuts and comprehensive presentations that enhance the viewing experience.

The user is likely to continue seeking fantasy-themed content and live performances that highlight exceptional music and engaging narratives, particularly those that appeal to family audiences while being discerning about production quality and social relevance in their selections.
